newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: China trading partners say more work ahead on WTO.
newsitem.headline: China trading partners say more work ahead on WTO.

text.p: A top Chinese negotiator, Long Yongtu, said on Friday that "very good progress" had been made with trading partners over terms for Beijing joining the World Trade Organisation (WTO).
U.S. and European Union trade officials told reporters that progress had been made, but said they would be looking for key concessions from China on market access when the WTO talks resumed in July.

Long, who is assistant foreign trade minister, was addressing a news conference after taking part in a WTO working party which is negotiating China's accession into the 131-member trade watchdog. Beijing first applied to join in 1986.
"We made very good progress. Everything is on track," Long said. "At the same time, we are also aware that there are still many difficulties in the market access negotiations."

Jim Wallace of the U.S. Trade Representative's Office told reporters that "momentum was maintained". Asked what Washington would seek in July, he said: "More fundamental progress on market access and a commitment from China, particularly on services."
EU ambassador Roderick Abbott told reporters: "There was modest progress. Modest is significant."
